position_description_html:
Job Description

Duties


The Spectrum Review is set to be the most significant reform of radiocommunications law and policy since 1992. The aim is to rewrite the 1992 legislation completely and also, at the same time, review the broadcasting planning powers in the Broadcasting Services Act.

Reporting directly to the Spectrum Review Implementation Taskforce Manager, the Senior Policy Advisor will be required to collaborate with and leverage off the skills and expertise of people within the Communications Infrastructure Division and across the ACMA, engage and influence key stakeholders, including the department, and deliver on project milestones to ensure the effective and successful design and implementation of this major policy reform.


Eligibility


To be eligible for employment with the ACMA applicants must be an Australian citizen.

An applicant's suitability for employment with the ACMA will be assessed through a pre-employment screening process. This process will include a requirement for the applicant to undergo and satisfy an AFP National Police Check and to complete a Health Declaration.


Notes


This position may be based in any of the following ACMA office locations: Canberra, Melbourne or Sydney.

About Australian Communications and Media Authority

ACMA is Australia’s regulator for broadcasting, the internet, radiocommunications and telecommunications.

We work with industry and government, locally and internationally, so that Australians can enjoy the best and most innovative media and communications services in a fair, responsible, safe and productive way.

The ACMA provides a supportive and respectful work environment that values the diversity of our employees. Our three main offices are in Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney. Visit acma.gov.au for more information on joining our team
